data.name: Container With Most Water
data.description:
This is a classic problem asked by some companies like Amazon and Google.

You are given a list of positive integers ```a(i), a(i+1), a(i+2), ..., a(n)``` where each one of them represents the height of a column in the x position ```i```.
Find two columns, which together with x-axis form a container, such that the container contains the most water.

The program should return an integer which corresponds to the maximum area of water that can be contained.

Example:

In this figure you recieve as input: ```[1,8,6,2,5,4,8,3,7]``` which should return 49.
![image title](https://s3-lc-upload.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/2018/07/17/question_11.jpg)


The test cases will be as follows:

```600``` tests of ```1 < length(list) <= 10^4```
where ```1 < list[i] <= 10^4```

Don't forget to leave you thoughts about the kata! :)

Good luck!
